tuv.seg: Becoming an Irish citizen through naturalisation
Ag éirí i do shaoránach de chuid na hÉireann trí eadóirseacht
Naturalisation means the process whereby a foreign national living in Ireland may apply to become an Irish citizen
Is éard a chiallaíonn eadóirseacht ná an próiseas trínar féidir le náisiúnach eachtrannach ar a bhfuil cónaí in Éirinn iarratas a dhéanamh chun saoránacht Éireannach a bhaint amach
In order to apply for naturalisation in Ireland, you must have been physically resident in Ireland for a certain length of time
Chun iarratas a dhéanamh ar eadóirseacht in Éirinn, ní mór duit gnáthchónaí fisiciúil a bheith ort in Éirinn ar feadh tréimhse áirithe ama
All applications to become a naturalised Irish citizen are decided by the Minister for Justice and Equality
Is é an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais a dhéanann cinneadh maidir le gach iarratas ar eadóirseacht mar shaoránach Éireannach
This Minister has absolute discretion as to whether or not to grant naturalisation
Tá discréid absalóideach ag an Aire maidir le cé acu an ndeonfar nó nach ndeonfar d'iarratas ar eadóirseacht
There are strict rules about applying for naturalisation as an Irish citizen and these rules are set out below
Tá rialacha diana ann faoi iarratas a dhéanamh ar eadóirseacht mar shaoránach Éireannach agus tá na rialacha seo leagtha amach thíos
You must use the current versions of the application forms on the INIS website - see 'How to apply' below
Caithfidh tú leagan reatha na foirmeacha iarratais ar fáil ar an suíomh gréasáin SEIS a úsáid – féach ‘Conas iarratas a dhéanamh’ thíos
There is an application fee of €175 - see 'Rates' below
Tá táille €175– féach ‘Rátaí’ thíos

Public Services Card: Since 19 September 2016, if you are applying for naturalisation and you are resident in the State, you must be registered with the Department of Social Protection for a Public Services Card

Cárta Seirbhísí Poiblí: Ó 19 Meán Fómhair 2016, má dhéanann tú iarratas ar eadóirseacht agus tá tú i do chónaí sa Stát, ní mór duit bheith cláraithe leis an Roinn Coimirce Sóisialaí do Chárta Seirbhísí Poiblí
Who is eligible for naturalisation?
Cé atá i dteideal eadóirseachta?
If you wish to become an Irish citizen through naturalisation, you must:
Más mian leat a bheith i do shaoránach Éireannach trí eadóirseacht, caithfidh tú:
• Be 18 years or older (you must be married if you are under the age of 18) or,
• A bheith 18 nó os a chionn (caithfidh tú bheith pósta má tá tú níos óige na 18) nó,
• Be a minor born in the State (from 1 January 2005) and
• A bheith i do mhionaoiseach a rugadh sa Stát (ón 1 Eanáir 2005) agus
• Be of good character - the Garda Síochána (Ireland's national police) will be asked to provide a report about your background
• Caithfidh dea-cháil a bheith ort - iarrfar ar an nGarda Síochána (póilíní náisiúnta na hÉireann) tuairisc a thabhairt ar do chúlra
Any criminal record or ongoing proceedings will be taken into consideration by the Minister for Justice and Equality in deciding whether or not to grant naturalisation
Déanfaidh an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais machnamh ar aon taifead coiriúil nó aon imeachtaí atá ag dul ar aghaidh faoi láthair sula gceadaítear eadóirseacht nó a mhalairt
Details of any proceedings, criminal or civil, in the State or elsewhere, should be disclosed in the application form, and
Ba cheart sonraí faoi imeachtaí ar bith, coiriúil nó sibhialta, sa Stát nó in áit ar bith eile, a nochtadh ar an bhfoirm iarratais, agus

• Have had a period of 365 days* (1 year) continuous reckonable residence in the State immediately before the date of your application for naturalisation and, during the 8 years preceding that, have had a total reckonable residence in the State amounting to 1,460 days* (4 years)

• Tréimhse cónaithe ináirithe leanúnach de 365 lá (bliain amháin) a bheith agat sa Stát díreach roimh dháta d'iarratas ar eadóirseacht agus, cónaí ináirithe iomlán sa Stát de 1,460 lá* (4 bliana) a bheith agat i rith na 8 mbliana roimhe sin
Altogether you must have 5 years (5 x 365 days*) reckonable residence out of the last 9 years - see ‘calculating reckonable residence’ below, and
San iomlán, caithfidh tú 5 bliana (5 x 365 lá*) de chónaí ináirithe a bheith agat sna 9 mbliana seo caite - féach an t-alt thíos maidir le cónaí ináirithe a ríomh, agus
• Intend in good faith to continue to reside in the State after naturalisation and
• Dea-rún a bheith agat leanúint ort ag cónaí sa Stát tar éis duit eadóirseacht a thabhairt amach

• Make a declaration of fidelity to the nation and loyalty to the State, and undertake to observe the laws of the State and respect its democratic values (see below for the point in the process at which this is required)

• Dearbhú dílseachta a dhéanamh don náisiún agus don Stát agus a ghealladh na dlíthe Stáit a chomhlíonadh agus a luachanna daonlathacha a urramú (féach thíos le fáil amach cathain is gá seo a dhéanamh)
*You must add 1 day for any period which includes 29 February
*Caithfidh tú cuir lá amháin le haon tréimhse lena n-áirítear 29 Feabhra
Normally, when you apply for naturalisation you must be supporting yourself and your dependants while living in Ireland - see 'Self supporting' below
De ghnáth, nuair déanann tú iarratas ar eadóirseacht, caithfidh tú agus do chleithiúnaithe bheith féintacaithe agus sibh in bhur gcónaí in Éirinn - féach 'Féintacaithe' thíos
The Minister for Justice and Equality has power to waive one or more of the conditions for naturalisation in the following circumstances:
Tá cumhacht ag an Aire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais aon cheann de na coinníollacha seo a tharscaoileadh sna himthosca a leanas:
• If you are of Irish descent or of Irish associations or are a parent or guardian applying on behalf of a minor child of Irish descent or Irish associations

• Más de bhunadh Éireannach tú, má tá baint agat le hÉirinn nó más tuismitheoir nó caomhnóir tú atá ag déanamh iarratais thar ceann mionaoisigh de bhunadh na hÉireann nó a bhfuil baint aige le hÉirinn
• If you have an entitlement to Irish citizenship if you were born on the island of Ireland
• Más rud é go raibh tú i dteideal bheith i do shaoránach Éireannach, má saolaíodh in oileán na hÉireann tú
• If you are a naturalised parent applying on behalf of a minor child
• Más tuismitheoir eadóirsithe tú atá ag déanamh iarratais thar ceann mionaoisigh
• If you are the spouse or civil partner of an Irish citizen or a naturalised person
• Más céile nó páirtnéir sibhialta saoránaigh de chuid na hÉireann tú nó duine eadóirsithe
• If you have been resident abroad in the public service
• Más rud é go raibh cónaí ort thar lear sa tseirbhís phoiblí
• If you are recognised as a refugee (under the 1951 Geneva Convention relating to the Status of Refugees) or a stateless person (under the 1954 UN Convention regarding Stateless Persons)
• Más rud é go n-aithnítear mar dhídeanaí tú (faoi Choinbhinsiún 1951 na Ginéive um Stádas Dídeanaithe) nó más duine gan stát tú (faoi Chonbhinsiún 1954 na Náisiún Aontaithe um Dhaoine gan Stát)
In the case of a refugee, stateless person or a person of Irish associations, the Minister will normally waive 2 of the 5 years' reckonable residence requirement
Sa chás dídeanaí, duine gan stát ná duine le baint aige/aici le hÉirinn, tarscaoileann an tAire 2 den 5 bhliain tréimhse chónaithe inghlactha riachtanach de ghnáth
Reckonable residence means periods of residence taken into account when examining an application for naturalisation
Clúdaíonn tréimhse chónaithe inghlactha tréimhsí cónaithe a chuirtear san áireamh nuair a scrúdaítear iarratas eadóirsithe
Certain periods of residence may be excluded from the reckoning when calculating periods of residence in the State
B'fhéidir go mbeidh roinnt tréimhsí cónaithe fágtha as an áireamh nuair a mheastar tréimhsí cónaithe sa Stát

These are periods when your presence in the State was not properly documented or (in certain cases) periods covered by a permission to remain that was for study purposes or while having a claim for asylum examined

Is iad seo tréimhsí nuair nach raibh cáipéisí faoin tréimhse a chaith tú sa Stát i gceart nó (i gcásanna áirithe) tréimhsí a clúdaíodh le cead a tugadh ar mhaithe le staidéar nó nuair a bhíothas ag scrúdú iarratais ar thearmann
You can use the online residency calculator on the INIS website to check if you meet the naturalisation residency conditions
Is féidir an t-áireamhán cónaitheachta ar líne sa suíomh gréasáin SEIS a úsáid chun seiceáil an bhfuil na coinníollacha eadóirseachta cónaitheachta sásta

EEA nationals: The time that a EEA or Swiss citizen has spent in the State is reckonable for naturalisation purposes as EEA and Swiss citizens are not required to have residence permits or documents under the European Communities (Free Movement of Persons) Regulations 2015

Cónaí inghlactha i gcomhair náisiúnach LEE: Tá an tréimhse atá caite ag saoránach de chuid an LEE nó na Sualainne sa Stát ináirithe chun críocha eadóirseachta os rud é nach gá do shaoránaigh de chuid an LEE agus na hEilvéise cáipéisí ná cead cónaithe a bheith acu faoi Rialacháin na gComhphobal Eorpach (Saorghluaiseacht Daoine) 2015
The European Economic Area (EEA) comprises the EU member states, Norway, Iceland and Liechtenstein
Tá an Limistéar Eorpach Eacnamaíoch (LEE) comhdhéanta as ballstáit an AE, an Iorua, an Íoslainn agus Lichtinstéin
Non-EEA nationals: If you are not an EEA or Swiss citizen, any time when you did not have permission to remain in the State will not be counted as reckonable residence

Cónaí inghlactha i gcomhair náisiúnach LEE: Muna bhfuil tú i do shaoránach de chuid an Aontais Eorpaigh, ní dhéantar tréimhse nuair a bhí iachall ort faoin dlí cead a bheith agat fanacht sa Stát ach nach raibh an cead sin agat, a chur san áireamh
Registration with immigration is the evidence of legal residence which meets the residency requirements for naturalisation
Is clárú leis an oifig um inimirce é fianaise ar chead fanachta sa Stát a chomlíonann na riachtanais cónaithe maidir le eadóírseacht
The following periods of residence will not be reckoned if the permission to remain:
Ní chuirtear tréimhsí cónaithe sa Stát san áireamh má tá an cead fanachta sin:
• Was for the purposes of study (that is, you were on a student visa) whether or not that study involved you being employed during any of the period of study, or
• Ar mhaithe le staidéar (bíodh go raibh tú fostaithe nó gan a bheith ag aon am le linn an staidéir sin) nó
• Was granted while your claim for asylum was being examined, if the claim was not granted. Refugees
• Tugtha fhad a bhíothas ag scrúdú d'iarratais ar thearmann
In general, apart from refugees and stateless persons, applicants for naturalisation must prove they can support themselves and their families while living in Ireland
De ghnáth, seachas dídeanaithe agus daoine gan stát, caithfidh iarratasóirí ar eadóirseacht cruthú gur féidir leo iad féin agus a gcuid clann a thacú agus iad ina gcónaí in Éirinn

If you can show that you have not received State support in the 3 years before your application, this will generally meet the Minister for Justice and Equality's requirement that you have been supporting yourself and your dependants and that you will continue to do so

Más féidir leat cruthú nach bhfaigheann tú tacaíocht Stáit ar feadh na 3 bhliain roimh d’iarratas, comhlíonfaidh tú riachtanas an Aire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais go bhfuil tú ag tacú tú féin agus do chleithiúnaithe agus go leanfaidh tú ar aghaidh é a dhéanamh
How your application for naturalisation is processed
Conas a phróiseáltar d'iarratas ar eadóirseacht
You will normally be informed within a week whether your application has passed the initial processing stage
De ghnáth, cuirfear fios duit laistigh de sheachtain an bhfuil d’iarratas ceadaithe san chéad chéim próiseáil
If your application passes the initial stage, it is then processed further along with all other applications that are on hand
Má tá d’iarratas tríd an chéad chéim ceadaithe, próiseáiltar d'iarratas in ord cróineolaíoch leis na hiarratais ar fad eile atá idir lámha
You will be given a reference number and you should quote this number when making queries either by phone or in writing
Tabharfar uimhir thagartha duit agus ba chóir duit seo a lua nuair a dhéanann tú fiosrúchán ar bith, bíodh sin ar an nguthán nó i gcló scríofa
For incorrect or incomplete applications, the process is longer, but you can keep it as short as possible by replying quickly to any queries
Maidir le hiarratais atá mí-cheart nó mí-chruinn, tá próiseas níos faide i gceist ach is féidir leat é a choinneáil chomh gairid agus is féidir thrí fhreagra luath a thabhairt ar cheisteanna
If further documentation or clarification is needed, you will be asked for it once processing of your application has begun
Má tá gá le tuilleadh cáipéisí nó soiléiriú, iarrfar sin ort chomh luath agus a thosaítear ag scrúdú d'iarratais
You will be informed by registered post as soon as a decision has been made on your application
Cuirfear in iúl duit trí phost cláraithe chomh luath agus atá cinneadh déanta maidir le d'iarratas
Generally most applications will be processed within 6 months
De ghnáth, beidh an chuid is mó iarratais próiseáilte laistigh 6 mhí

If your application is approved, the letter notifying you of this decision will contain instructions regarding the final procedures that must be completed before the certificate of naturalisation can be issued
Má éiríonn le d'iarratas, beidh eolas sa litir a chuirfidh an cinneadh seo in iúl duit faoin bpróiseas deireanach a chaithfear a chríochnú sula n-eisítear an teastas eadóirseachta
When you submit the required documentation and certification fee, you will be invited to a citizenship ceremony at which you will be granted your certificate of naturalisation
Nuair cuireann tú na cáipéisí riachtanacha agus táille dheimhniúcháin isteach, tabharfar cuireadh duit ar shearmanas saoránachta agus tabharfar duit do theastas eadóirseachta
You are an Irish citizen from the date of issue of the certificate and you can apply to the Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade for an Irish passport any time after that date

Tá tú i do shaoránach Éireannach ó dháta eisiúint an teastais anuas agus is féidir leat iarratas a chur isteach do Roinn Gnóthaí Eachtracha agus Trádála i gcóir pas Éireannach ag am ar bith tar éis an dáta sin
The certificate of naturalisation is written in Irish
Tá an teastas eadóirseacht scríofa i nGaeilge
The English version is Form 11 in the schedule of the Irish Nationality and Citizenship (Amendment) Regulations 2011
Is an leagan Béarla é Foirm 11 sa sceideal na Rialacháin Náisiúntachta agus Saoránachta Éireann (Leasú) 2011
The Minister for Justice and Equality can revoke your certificate of naturalisation if:
Is féidir leis an Aire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais do theastas eadóirseachta a chúlghairm más rud é:
• You obtained it through fraud, misrepresentation or concealment of material facts or circumstances
• Go bhfuair tú é trí chalaois, mhífhaisnéis nó cheilt de fhíricí nó imthosca ábhartha
• You have, through an overt act, failed in your duty of fidelity to the nation and loyalty to the State
• Gur theip ort, trí ghníomh follasach, i do dhualgas a bheith dílis don náisiún agus don Stát

• You were ordinarily resident outside Ireland (other than in public service) for a continuous period of 7 years and, without a reasonable excuse, did not register your name and a declaration of your intention to retain Irish citizenship with an Irish diplomatic mission or consular office or with the Minister for Justice and Equality on an annual basis - see 'How to apply' below

• Go raibh cónaí ort go hiondúil taobh amuigh d'Éirinn (seachas i seirbhís phoiblí) ar feadh tréimhse leanúnaí seacht mbliana agus, gan leiscéal réasúnta, nár chláraigh tú d'ainm agus do dhearbhú go raibh tú chun do shaoránacht Éireannach a choinneáil le misiún taidhleoireachta nó oifig chonslachta Éireannach nó leis an Aire Dlí agus Cirt, Comhionnanais agus Comhionannais ar bhonn bliantúil - féach 'Conas iarratas a dhéanamh' thíos
• You are also, under the law of a country at war with the State, a citizen of that country
• Go bhfuil tú, faoi dhlí tíre atá i mbun cogaidh leis an Stát, i do shaoránach de chuid na tíre sin
• You have, by any other voluntary act other than marriage or registration of civil partnership, acquired citizenship of another country
• Go bhfuair tú, trí aon ghníomh deonach eile seachas pósadh nó páirtnéireacht sibhialta a chlárú saoránacht tíre eile

Before revoking your certificate of naturalisation, the Minister for Justice and Equality will inform you in advance, stating the reasons why the certificate is being revoked and your right to apply to the Minister for an inquiry into the reasons for the revocation

Sula ndéanann an tAire Dlí agus Cirt agus Comhionannais, do theastas eadóirseachta a chúlghairm, cuirfear in iúl duit roimh ré, ag cur na fáthanna in iúl a bhfuiltear á chúlghairm agus faoin gceart a bheidh agat iarratas a dhéanamh don Aire chun fiosrúchán a reachtáil faoi fháth a chúlghairme
If you apply for an inquiry into a decision to revoke your certificate of naturalisation, the Minister will refer your case to a Committee of Inquiry, which will report its findings to the Minister
Má chuireann tú isteach ar fhiosrúchán faoi chinneadh chúlghairm do theastais eadóirseachta , cuirfidh an tAire do chúis faoi bhráid Choiste Fiosrúcháin, a thabharfaidh tuairisc don Aire
A notice of the revocation of your certificate of naturalisation will be published in Iris Oifigiúil (Ireland's official State Gazette)
Foilseofar fógra faoi chúlghairm do theastais eadóirseachta in Iris Oifigiúil
The fee for each application for naturalisation is €175
Is é €175 an táille do gach iarratas ar eadóirseacht
The following are the relevant fees to be paid when the certificate of naturalisation is issued
Is iad seo na táillí cuí nuair a n-eisítear an teastas eadóirseachta
Application on behalf of a minor €200
Iarratas thar ceann mionaoisigh €200
Widow, widower or surviving civil partner of Irish citizen €200
Baintreach, baintreach fir nó páirtnéir sibhialta marthanach saoránaigh Éireannaigh €200
Refugee, stateless person or programme refugee No charge
Dídeanaí, duine gan stát nó clárdhídeanaí Gan táille
You must use the current versions of the application forms on the INIS website
Caithfidh tú an leagan reatha na foirmeacha iarratais ar an suíomh gréasáin SÉIS a úsáid
The current application forms are:
Seo na foirmeacha iarratais reatha:
• Form 8 (pdf) for a person aged 18 or over
• Foirm 8 (pdf) le haghaidh duine lánfhásta
• Form 9 (pdf) for the minor child of a naturalised Irish citizen
• Foirm 9 (pdf) le haghaidh mionaoisigh saoránaigh eadóirsithe Éireannaigh
• Form 10 (pdf), an electronic form which should be completed online by parents of a minor child of Irish descent or Irish associations
• Foirm 10 (pdf), foirm leictreonach ba ghá do thuismitheoir/caomhnóir mionaosaigh, de bhunadh Éireannach nó a bhfuil baint aige le hÉirinn, í ar líne a chomhlánú
There is a guidance note on how to complete form 10 (pdf)
Tá treoirnóta maidir le conas foirm 10 a chomhlánú (pdf)
• Form 11 (pdf), an electronic form which should be completed online by a parent/guardian of a minor child born in the State who was not entitled to Irish citizenship at birth
• Foirm 11 (pdf), foirm leictreonach ba ghá do thuismitheoir/caomhnóir mionaosaigh a rugadh in Éirinn í nach bhfuil i dteideal saoránacht Éireannach nuair rugadh é/í, ar líne a chomhlánú
The child must be at least 5 years of age when the application is made
Ní mór don mionaosaigh bheith 5 bliana d’aois ar a laghad nuair déantar an t-iarratas
The parent/guardian must have 5 years' reckonable residence since the birth of the child, including the full year immediately prior to the date of application
Caithfidh an tuismitheoir/caomhnóir 5 bliana de chónaí ináirithe ó bhreith an leanbh a bheith acu, lena n-áirítear an bhliain iomlán díreach roimh dháta iarratas
There is a guidance note on how to complete form 11 (pdf)
Tá treoirnóta maidir le conas foirm 11 a chomhlánú (pdf)
• Form 5 (pdf), annual registration form and declaration of intention to retain Irish citizenship for a naturalised Irish citizen resident outside Ireland
• Foirm 5 (pdf), foirm clárúcháin bhliantúil agus dearbhú intinne chun saoránacht Éireannach a choinneáil do shaoránach eadóirsithe Éireannach atá ina chónaí taobh amuigh d’Éire
You can find more information about Irish citizenship and naturalisation on the INIS website
Tá tuilleadh faisnéise maidir le saoránacht agus eadóirseacht ar fáil ar an suíomh gréasáin SEIS
The supporting documents required depend on your situation; you will need to provide evidence of your identity and nationality (long-form birth certificate and passport)
I measc na gcáipéisí eile atá ag teastáil, tá fianaise d'aitheantais agus do náisiúnachta (teastas breithe sa bhfoirm fhada agus pas)

Allow at least 4 weeks for your passport to be returned to you. Since 19 September 2016, if you are resident in the State, you must be registered for a Public Services Card (PSC) and you must include a copy of your PSC with your application form
Ó 19 Meán Fómhair 2016, má tá tú i do chónaí sa Stát, caithfidh tú bheith cláraithe do Chárta Seirbhísí Poiblí (CSP) agus caithfidh tú cóip do CSP a chur isteach le d’fhoirm iarratais
You also need to produce documents relating to your status and the duration of your stay in the State (Certificate of Registration, declaration of refugee status, or the like)
Caithfidh tú freisin cáipéisí a thaispeáint maidir le do stádas agus faoin tréimhse a bheidh tú ag stopadh sa Stát (teastas clárúcháin, ráiteas faoi stádas dídeanaí nó a leithéid)
If you are a non-EEA national applying for naturalisation your residency stamps are the only evidence which provide proof of your reckonable residence
Más náisiúnach neamh-LEE thú agus ag iarraidh ar shaorántacht, níl ach do stampaí cónaitheachta amháin an cruthúnas do thréimhse chónaithe inghlactha

If your application for naturalisation is based on your relationship to an Irish citizen, you will need to produce the documents needed to show that person's status and your relationship to that person (for example birth or naturalisation certificate of Irish spouse, marriage certificate, civil partnership certificate)

Má tá d'iarratas ar eadóirseacht bunaithe ar an ngaol atá agat le saoránach Éireannach, caithfidh tú na cáipéisí faoi stádas an duine sin agus faoin ngaol atá agat leis a thaispeáint (mar shampla teastas breithe nó eadóirseachta ag céile nó páirtnéir sibhialta Éireannach, teastas pósta, teastas páirtnéireachta sibhialta)
The copies of birth, marriage, civil partnership, divorce and other certificates, such as the photo page of your passport, must be certified documents
Caithfidh na cóipeanna de na teastais bhreithe, pósta, páirtnéireachta sibhialta, colscartha agus teastais eile, mar shampla an fótaleathanach do phas, bheith cáipéisí deimhnithe
You will be expected to produce the original documents for inspection at a later stage during the examination of your application
Beidh dúil go mbeidh sé i do chumas na bundindiúirí a thaispeáint níos faide anonn nuair a táthar ag scrúdú d'iarratais

As well as these documents, if you are 18 or over and applying for naturalisation, you must produce documents relevant to your financial and employment status (copies of 3 pay slips and 3 bank statements dated within the previous 6 months) and confirmation of your income tax situation

Chomh maith leis na cáipéisí seo, caithfidh tú cáipéisí a thaispeáint maidir le do stádas fostaíochta (duillíní pá le haghaidh na 3 mí deireanach, ráitis bhainc le haghaidh na 3 mí a chuaigh thart) agus dearbhú faoi do staid maidir le cáin ioncaim
You should only send copies of the above documents with your application form
Níor cheart ach cóipeanna amháin de na rudaí seo a sheoladh i dteannta le d'fhoirm iarratais
The information in your application form will be checked against the supporting documentation and any inaccuracy will lead to delays in ruling on your application
Seiceálfar an t-eolas i d'fhoirm iarratais le hais na gcáipéis lena cois agus beidh moill ann mar thoradh ar aon mhí-chruinneas maidir le cinneadh a thabhairt ar d'iarratas
You should not sign the form until you are in the presence of the person who must witness you signing it
Níor cheart ainm a chur leis an bhfoirm go dtí go mbeidh tú i láthair finné
The application form contains instructions about who is eligible to be a witness
Tá eolas ar an bhfoirm iarratais maidir le cé atá i dteideal a bheith mar fhinné
Lost or stolen certificate of naturalisation
Teastas eadóirseachta caillte nó goidte
If your certificate of naturalisation is lost or stolen, you should write to the Citizenship Division of INIS – see ‘Where to apply’ below
Má tá do theastas eadóirseachta caillte nó goidte, ba chóir duit scríobh chuig an Rannóg Saoránacht – féach ‘Cá háit a ndéanfaidh mé iarratas’
You will not get a replacement certificate but instead you will be given a statement confirming your Irish citizenship
Ní fhaigheann tú athchur teastais, ach tabharfar ráiteas a dheimhníonn do shaoránacht Éireannach
There is no fee for this service
Níl aon táille le haghaidh na seirbhíse seo
If you are applying for an Irish passport you will need this statement to accompany your passport application
Má dhéanann tú iarratas ar phas Éireannach, is gá duit an ráiteas seo chun gabháil le d’iarratas
New applications for minors (Form 9, 10 or 11) should be sent to Citizenship Applications, Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service, PO Box 12079, Dublin 1

Ní mór iarratais nua le haghaidh leanaí mionaoiseacha (Foirm 9, 10 nó 11) a sheol chuig Iarratais ar Shaoránacht, Seirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann, Bosca Poist 12079, Baile Átha Cliath 1
Note: this address is only for lodging new applications
Nóta: ní bhaineann an seoladh ach amháin le hiarratais nua
All other correspondence for minors should be sent to the address on the letter sent to you
Bá chóir an uile chomhfhreagras eile a sheol chuig seoladh an litir a sheoladh chugat
New applications for adults (form 8) should be sent to Citizenship Applications, Irish Naturalisation and Immigration Service, PO Box 73, Tipperary Town
Ní mór iarratais nua le haghaidh duine fásta (Foirm 8) a sheol chuig Iarratais ar Shaoránacht, Seirbhís Eadóirseachta agus Inimirce na hÉireann, Bosca Poist 73, Baile Thiobraid Áran
Note: this address is only for lodging new applications
Nóta: ní bhaineann an seoladh ach amháin le hiarratais nua
All other citizenship correspondence should be sent to Citizenship Division – see below
Bá chóir an uile chomhfhreagras eile a sheol chuig Rannóg Saoránacht - féach thíos
